So since I'm Nextel subscriber I thought about getting the new camera phone but it's going to cost me like $285 when all is said and done. So I was thinking maybe I shoud just invest in a nice digital camera that is small and compact....of course you can't take inconspicuos photos with the digital camera. Anyways what are your thoughts?
If you're actually wanting to take decent photos, get the camera and don't bother blowing your money on a camera phone. And exactly what kind of "incinspicuos photos" are you talking about anyway?

The latest top end camera phones are limited to 1.3M pixels, crummy resolution unless one specializes in passport sized images. $285 will buy a decent camera about the same size as a small cell phone.

What's with these stupid camera phones? My first cell phone--a basic Nokia--had much better reception than the new camera phone I was required to buy as part of the two year agreement. So now I have a cheesy camera, which I never use, and a phone that drops calls like a hot potato. Progress?
 
 Next they'll put a stupid radio on the stupid phone too. Stupid.

What's with these stupid camera phones? My first cell phone--a basic Nokia--had much better reception than the new camera phone I was required to buy as part of the two year agreement. So now I have a cheesy camera, which I never use, and a phone that drops calls like a hot potato. Progress?
 
 Next they'll put a stupid radio on the stupid phone too. Stupid.

 
 Did you change service providers? Reception is generally dependent on antenna/repeater placement. Most companies offer a map showing signal strength by geographical location using ratings of great, good, fair, none.
I've always been with Verizon. A company technician told me after I asked about the problems I was having with calls that camera phones "may experience poorer reception".

I've always been with Verizon. A company technician told me after I asked about the problems I was having with calls that camera phones "may experience poorer reception".

 
 Dump the camera phone?

Next they'll put a stupid radio on the stupid phone too. Stupid.

 
 I got one of those (it got camera, radio, e-mail, internet connection, etc etc)... :p 
 
 It wasn`t as pricy as 285 dollars though since I got a pretty decent deal on it.
 
 
 
 Oh, and the cameraphotos are really crappy for anything else than storing them on the phone and showing or sending them to friends (which is pretty funny). Go for the camera if you`r interested in taking photos. Go for the phone if you need a phone.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Camera Phone(Nextel) or Digital Camera(Sony)?
